content.full_text:
Receipt of Abraham Lincoln to Anderson, 5 February 18551 Received, Feby 5. 1855 ofAndersonby the hand ofW. H. Lamon, twentyfive dollars, being in full of all demands, and particularly of a note for that sum, being

the only note I hold or ever held against him, which note is not now at hand to be

delivered up–2
paragraphs: Receipt of Abraham Lincoln to Anderson, 5 February 18551 Received, Feby 5. 1855 ofAndersonby the hand ofW. H. Lamon, twentyfive dollars, being in full of all demands, and particularly of a note for that sum, being
the only note I hold or ever held against him, which note is not now at hand to be

footnotes.text: 1Abraham Lincoln wrote and signed this receipt.

2Anderson could not be positively identified. It is therefore unclear why he was indebted
                  to Lincoln.

Received, Feby[February] 5. 1855 ofAndersonby the hand ofW. H. Lamon, twentyfive dollars, being in full of all demands, and particularly of a note for that sum, being
               the only note I hold or ever held against him, which note is not now at hand to be
